Question: Originally, this person intended to call the journal The Penn, as it would have been based in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania.
Hints: Though it made this person a household name almost instantly, he was paid only $9 for its publication.
This person was promoted to "artificer", an enlisted tradesman who prepared shells for artillery, and had his monthly pay doubled.
This person tactically pled not guilty to induce dismissal, knowing he would be found guilty.
